title: Drawing, "Design for a Creamer", October 1941
medium: Pen and black ink, graphite, on verso, white and yellow pastel on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: 47
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, lower center: CREMIER (C)/DIAMETRE 10cms/HAUTEUR 7 cms [with arrows indicated measurements should be reversed]; lower right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/10.41.; in graphite on lower part of creamer: XX
dimensions: 24. 8 X 18.4 cm (9 3/4 X 7 1/4 in.), irregular sheet
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description: Pear-shaped creamer drawn in elevation with an applied scallop-edged lower body indicated in yellow pastel to be executed in vermeil, attached C-scroll handle indicated in white pastel to be executed in ivory, raised in short flaring base. Placement of screw indicated by circle on upper handle. Underdrawing in graphite of creamer in golden section.
